812019992595412324.Text: As you know, he's probably the oldest and most powerful wizard alive. Not counting liches, or divine sorcerers like Vivec, of course. And there may be some older in the West, on Summerset Isles, perhaps. And I don't think there's a kinder, more generous wizard alive. Not that there's much competition in the kind-and-generous-wizard department, I'll grant you.

13752119553133027041.Text: Lord Fyr is in his study. I'm sure he won't mind being disturbed. We get few visitors here. You CAN levitate, can't you? The study is on an upper level, accessible only by the central flywell. I'm afraid we aren't set up to accommodate barbarians or peasants. Understand? Go up the ramps to the Hall of Fyr, then walk around, looking up, until you see a shaft above you. Then levitate. Up the shaft. Then look for Lord Fyr in his study.

11812191621321520980.Text: He's up above in his study. I hope you can fly. You can't get up there unless you can fly. Or have potions. Sorry.

152832703644445152.Text: He's in his study. He's busy. He's always busy.

60412147127613925.Text: Divayth Fyr is one of the oldest mortals on Tamriel. He could be the Telvanni Archmagister, but he doesn't care about that stuff. He just wants to collect Dwemer artifacts and Daedric artifacts and corprus victims. He welcomes thieves and adventurers, says they can have anything they can get away with. He must have a right rich booty in there, considering the ones that go in and don't come out.

2164126887101464726.Text: He lives in Tel Fyr. He is one of the oldest and most respected wizards in House Telvanni, though he shows an unfortunate lack of interest in politics. To get to Tel Fyr, you'll have to swim or fly southwest from Sadrith Mora. It's a long trip. Perhaps I should mark Tel Fyr on your map.
